values:
Whoops, I forgot to give an update regarding my previous post, how thoughtless of me. My mom made it through the surgery, and aside from the long scar across the front of her neck she is doing just fine. The amazing thing is that three doctors had previously diagnosed her with cancer, but after examining the part of her thyroid that was removed from the surgery, there was no cancer to be found. The doctors couldn't explain it, but I sure can.  Thanks so much to everyone who prayed for her, it's obvious that God still performs miracles even today.

Well it's just a couple more days till I move into my new house. I really wish I could be more excited about it, but I'm more nervous and anxious than anything.  I just hope I don't pass out after I hand the title company that cashier's check on Friday.  I've already payed $5,000 in earnest and this final closing payment is going to be more than twice that much.  That's going to be the single largest amount of money I've ever turned over at one time thus far in my life, by far. I haven't even bought a fridge and washer/dryer yet either.  And then I'll have to buy nice new furniture because my old apartment stuff will look like crap in a brand new house.  Ok, I'm going to stop now because I'm getting nauseous just thinking about it.

the good news is, i have a new niece on the way...

the bad news is, my mom has cancer and is going in for surgery on friday...

Well after years of padding other people's real estate investment pockets (renting), I've finally taken the leap to home ownership.  Being the new venture that it is for me, my feelings of excitement are somewhat overshadowed by feelings of anxiety.  

They currently have the frame and roof completed, and will be doing the dry wall next. I met with the builder yesterday and he expects it to be completed around mid-October.  It's progressing super fast, hopefully it will still be quality work.  But I'm impressed with the other homes they've built, and the models were amazing. Here are some specs on it:

~2,875 sq ft
2 story
4 bedrooms
study
gameroom
media room (converted 5th bedroom to this)
dining area
kitchen, breakfast nook
living room

The media room will have two levels for elevated seating, and I'm having it prewired for surround sound so I can install in-wall speakers. Also planning on installing a DLP projector, for a mini-theater setup.

Here's a few upgrades I got, pulled off my purchase agreement (most of this doesn't mean much to me to be honest, lol):

Premium lot (larger back yard on golf course)
Hardwood Floors
Solid granite countertops
All stainless steel kitchen appliances
Stainless steel undermount sink
Recessed can lighting
Custom kitchen backsplash tile and accents
42" Raised panel cherry cabinets
8' six-panel front door
7" double-staged crown molding
Twin panelled french doors for study
Wrought iron stairs with waterfall stain grade, oak starter step and volute
Rounded sheetrock corners
etc, etc.


Here is a link to picture, floor plan and virtual tour of the same model that I bought.  

http://www.meritagehomestexas.com/cgi-bin/homeplan.pl?plan_id=2471

..you take a keyboard, lousy ps2 headset (came with Karaoke revolution game), Windows sound recorder, and too much time on your hands, and mix them all together.

http://savefile.com/projects/425022


I was actually somewhat pleased how it turned out, given the aforementioned ingredients. It's obvious I can play keyboard better than sing, but too my credit my voice was kinda shot today. I may do some more tomorrow if I get bored again and my voice clears up. Enjoy!
Welp, it's official.  I'll be moving to McKinney, Texas on Sept 4th...

In case your reeeaaaally bored, here's my updated DVD Collection. For somereason mystupid spacebar isnot workingverywell todayarghhhhh...

That was the closing line to Cowboy Bebop: The Movie (at least it was something to that effect).. that I just got back from watching at the bankrupt United Artists cinema in Boulder. It was a basically like a typical Cowboy Bebop episode (which isn't a bad thing at all), but stretched out to about 2 hours. Definitely entertaining, and somewhat thought-provoking.. I'll be picking up the DVD when it comes out here in another couple of weeks, I believe. I still haven't bought the regular series on DVD yet... for one, I want the Perfect Sessions box set, however it's going for crazy prices on eBay (the real one anyway if you can find it, almost ALL those on eBay and other auctions are burns/fakes.. good rule of thumb, if it's not going for at least $300, it's not the real thing), and I don't like it THAT much to drop $300+ bucks on it. I actually do have the first session DVD, that my ex bought me a while back, but it's still in the shrink wrap. The current DVDs are actually pretty barebones... I guess I'm just holding out in hopes that they'll release a new box set with special edition DVDs. On a related note, my otaku-buddy Julian that I watched the Bebop movie with, just informed me that they're going to be releasing a new DVD box set of Neon Genesis Evangelion, of which I just bought the old set for $100... frickin figures. So why is mine called the "Perfect Collection" then? I guess the new one is gonna be "The More Perfect Collection". I know it's kinda stupid, but it bothers me when I own a DVD and they release a better version of the same movie/show. I feel almost compelled to buy the newer one, and I almost always do. I'm sure the movie studio's love suckers like me...

How compatible with me are YOU?

Howdy people, hope all is well in LJ-land!

Well it appears as if my post frequency has slimmed down to the "once a year or so" update.  I thought it would be nice of me to let everyone out there know I'm still alive.  RealLife has been kickin' my arse lately.  My job takes up most of my time, and my girlfriend takes up the rest of it.  If there's any time left over from that, you can usually find me spending it on the slopes carving some fresh powder.  

Speaking of fresh powder, holy balls it's been snowing out here a lot the last couple days.  It finally stopped, but there must be at least 2 feet on the ground now-- perfect for a huge snowball battle royale!   I just finished luring the gf outside to show her all the snow.  Translation-- to show her a fat snowball to the back of the head, muhahahhaha.  She's really happy that she just got her DSL hooked up a few days ago, so we've both been working from her place.  I guess that is one cool thing I can say about my job is that I can work remotely when I need to.

Lately I've actually been contemplating going back to school and taking some classes in 3D animation.  My dream job has always been either working for a movie company like Pixar doing artwork and/or animation, or working for a video gaming company.  My original intention was to major in Graphic Design, although at the time back in '95 all they really offered at OU was Visual Communications, and they weren't doing much in the way of 3D animation.  So yeah, I chose college over career.  So now I'm wanting to go back and do it right the 2nd time, before I get too dang old.

I guess a lot has happened in a year, let's see... 

Bought a 2002 Nissan XTerra, 4X4 SE Supercharged loaded last year to make boarding trips up the mountains a little easier.  The old Sunfire just wasn't cutting it.  

Got hit my some huge bouncing metal object while driving on I-25 that jacked up said XTerra and nearly took my life.  

Got deathly sick last December to the point where I could only drink liquids because I was throwing up anything solid I tried to eat, and couldn't even sit up in bed.  Probably would have kicked the bucket if it wasn't for my awesome girlfriend taking care of me.  

Went on a trip to New York City for the first time in my life.  Saw Les Miserables on Broadway!  Got to experience riding in a subway and walking through Harlem.... very interesting.  

My sister had a baby boy!  This was exciting for us as some of you know she has a disease called endometriosis from which the doctors said she probably would not be able to conceive.  She named him Heath... er??

My girlfriend bought me a fullsize Yamaha 88 key electric piano for my birthday last year, I love it!

My DVD collection has grown to somewhere around 200, I got tired of counting.

Bought a Gamecube so that I could get Metroid Prime and also Zelda when it comes out in a few days (got my preorder in!)

Still haven't bought a  widescreen tv yet.  I've been holding off hoping that prices on plasma tvs will go down, which doesn't seem to be happening any time soon.  A plasma would be ideal for me since I live in a 3rd floor apartment and getting a 60" widescreen rear-projection up 3 flights of stairs would be a major pain in my arse, not to mention my back.  I noticed that Gateway has put out a plasma for $3,000 and I've seen a couple at Cost-Co for around $3,000, but from what I've heard about the Gateway, and seen myself with the ones at Cost-Co, the quality doesn't seem to be that good, especially when viewing normal broadcasts it appears very pixelated.  I've decided that $3,000 is my limit, besides I really can't afford anything much more expensive.

Watched Stomp for the first time in Denver the other night, it rocked.

I played on a flag football team in the Denver Sportsmonster league last fall with some guys from work.  Man did we suck.  They ended up putting us in a league with like ex-college and semi-pro players so that didn't help either... we lost every game, haha!  I did have 5 picks one game though.  I think our QB threw more interceptions than he did receptions.  Ah well it was still fun.

Mandarin and I have been talking about putting up a website where we can showcase our mad 3D designing skillz, but so far it's just in the conceptual stage.  Ok so we're having trouble thinking of a cool domain name.. so if any of you have any bright ideas, please let me know.  And no stupid stuff like holyballs.com (that one's already taken).  

Well I'm sure there's some just as boring stuff that happened to me that I'm just forgetting about, but if I have any other brilliant strokes of genius I'll be sure and let ya know.

~fin

It liiiiiiiives, ahhhhhhhhh... Man, it's been awhile. A lot has happened since I last visited this page. RealLife(TM) has taken hold and doesn't want to let go. I won't bore you with the details, so here is a brief synopsis of semi-interesting goings on in my life for the past couple months. - Flew home to Oklahoma for two weeks to be with my family for Christmas.. (Colorado's nice but Oklahoma will always be my home) - Got a nifty iPaq pocket pc from my parents - Been snowboarding 6 times now (3X@ Breckenridge, 2X@ Keystone, 1X@ A-Basin) I'm getting much better =) - My DVD collection is now somewhere in the 80s I think (I got tired of counting) - Bought myself a Playstation2 for Christmas, got SSX Tricky and Final Fantasy X - Just got my first cell phone yesterday. It's pretty cool, here is a picture and specs if you're interested. It has the ability to download new ringers and graphics to it, but unfortunately they don't offer it on business plans, ie. the one I have through IBM. Ah well, guess I'll just have to wait for some geek out there to write a program that will do it... or write one myself =). - My friends left on a weekend trip to Vail, and I sit here confined in my apartment with this crappy hotpager - Going to buy a widescreen TV sometime soon if I can bring myself to cough up that much cash... it's weird but I've found that I get nauseated when I have to fork over a large amount of money... like when I have to pay my rent each month =| - I am now a single guy once again...

Instant messages can get kind of strange when you're bored on a Friday...

me: What kind of car did you get?
tien: 2001 Maxima, limited edition
me: Niice, you must be makin' the big bucks
tien: funny
tien: i don't make much
tien: probably a lot less than you
me: yeah right
tien: serious
me: i make minimum wage
tien: me less
me: my boss told me if i behave i might get a dollar raise in a couple years
tien: i won't even get one. beat that
me: i might be able to get that scooter i've been wanting now
tien: hhahaha
me: i make more money bummin' the streets in Boulder on the weekends than i do here
tien: hahaha
tien: no doubt about that
me: i use the money i make here to buy more cardboard to make signs
tien: hahahahha
me: don't laugh at my poverty!
me: =P
tien: whatever. you think you're poor
tien: not as poor as me
tien: i just got charged for insufficient funds. beat that
me: yeah i'm sorry i stole your cardboard box house, i had to use it to make more signs
tien: =) this guy
me: i'll bring you a new one soon.. i've got connections.  my cousin just got hired on at the local grocery store, they've got tons of cardboard!
tien: hahahaha

I still haven't gotten to go snowboarding yet. Hopefully that will change this weekend, I'm really amped to go :). OK I stole "amped" from a commercial that just came on for a snowboarding game of the same name on the X-Box. Looks really cool, maybe even better than SSX Tricky. That along with HALO make me want to get an X-Box but I'm still gonna have to stick with the Playstation2 since only it has Final Fantasy X. My car has been acting strange ever since the cold weather hit, and it finally decided to poop out on me on the way to work today. So I had to walk a mile back to my apartment freezing my buns off along the way. I then decided to walk back to it and get the battery out (which was dead) and carried that back to charge it up. When my friend Brian (who lives below me) got in from work, we drove back and put the battery back in. It started up and I was able to drive it back to the apartment, but I'm afraid it might be the alternator. Guess I'll find out when I get up tomorrow morning. Methinks it's about time for a new ride-- here are a couple I've got my eye on... * 2002 Acura RSX Type-S * 2002 Audi TT Newest DVDs in my collection: - Willow - Willy Wonka Widescreen - Shrek - Die Hard - The Ultimate Collection box set - Toy Story - Ultimate Toybox box set (off eBay) Let's see, that brings the total to... 71. Is it an addiction? Of course not.. I can quit any time! ;) I'll definitely be adding Monsters Inc. to the collection when it's released on DVD. I watched it one night at the cool Westminster Promenade theater and really enjoyed it. I do believe I liked it better than both the Toy Stories and Shrek. What about work? Oh yeah, that. It's going just fine actually. I don't overly enjoy the work, but not many people get to start off in their dream job immediately out of college. However, the company is very stable, the work isn't too difficult, the people are nice, and the pay I can't complain about either, so it will do for now. I definitely don't plan on doing the same thing the rest of my life though, not to say that it won't be with the same company. Welp kiddies, that's the "What's goin' on in the Life of Bone" monthly report for November. See ya back again next month.. Not so same Bat-time, not so same Bat-channel.

paul> Man, I want to get out of here so bad, but all this crap keeps pouring in

me> give it to jim, he'll get it squared away real quick

paul> lol

me> he's a master at problem determination and resolution

paul> Wow, youre starting to sound like a PM

me> here's jim's method for problem resolution: 

me> 1st day: go around asking about 10 people the same question, who all give him the same answer

me> 2nd day: talk to self and bang stuff around at desk

me> 3rd day: Walk by other people's desk talking to self and banging stuff around

me> 2 weeks later: attempt to solve problem by own methods

me> 1 day later: we actually solve the problem using the method we told him in the first place

paul> How about the power naps where do these fit in

me> those are inbetween the 3rd day and 2 weeks

paul> Nice

Today the ruling members of the Taliban held a press conference threatening the United States if its territory is invaded.

Immigration Czar Mohammed Ali Momaluke stated that the Afghan authorities "would not hesitate for a moment" to cut off the US supply of convenience store managers.

I'm sure by now most everyone has seen this picture... Well, it seems some more pictures have surfaced which prove that this guy is pretty unlucky when it comes to planning vacations... Obviously, these wouldn't be funny if the first picture was real. But hopefully you all know that it isn't. For one thing, what are the odds of snapping a picture at that very moment, and what are the odds of that camera making it all the way down, unscathed? I didn't do too hot in my stats class, but that must be somewhere around a billion to one chance. Also, why would the guy be wearing heavy winter clothes in Fall weather? And the most revealing: that picture was taken from the 2nd tower. There's no way those guys could have been oblivious to what was going on at the first tower. But if you still don't believe me (or all the credible news sites that also say it's a hoax), here's recorded proof that the guy is OK...

And there went out another horse that was red: and power was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword. Revelations 6:4, The Holy Bible, KJV

Stay, and let me look at you
It's been so long, I hardly knew you
Standing in the door
Stay with me a while
I only wanna talk to you
We've traveled halfway 'round the world
To find ourselves again
September morn
We danced until the night became a brand new day
Two lovers playing scenes from some romantic play
September morning still can make me feel that way

Look at what you've done
Why, you've become a grown-up girl
I still can hear you crying
In a corner of your room
And look how far we've come
So far from where we used to be
But not so far that we've forgotten
How it was before

September morn
Do you remember how we danced that night away
Two lovers playing scenes from some romantic play
September morning still can make me feel that way

Well, I had a pretty swell labor day weekend.  This week is going to be nice as far as work is concerned, because I got off today, I'm going to work from home tomorrow, and then I'm taking Wednesday off for my birthday.

I apologize for not reading/posting in anyone's journal lately, I've just been busy with work and other activities and just haven't had the time.  A friend of mine named Brian that I met here (he lives below me, and also started working for IBM at the same time) just sent me some pictures he took at a Rockies/Braves game that I went with him to a couple weeks ago. The Rockies got spanked as usual, but it was still fun since Brian had never been to a pro MLB game, and the last one I had been to was a Texas Rangers game about 10 or so years ago.  

In other news, I watched the somewhat sad performance by OU in their first game of the season.  They did win, but the offense seemed terribly lacking.  Hybl has some large shoes to fill, and I believe he realizes that.  It was his first "real" game however, so maybe (hopefully) he'll start gaining a little more confidence.

Finally, I ordered my home theater system, and 4 of the speakers (Polks) have arrived so far.  They look pretty nice, but it's really annoying just having them sitting here and still watching DVDs through my mono tv speaker waiting for the receiver to arrive.  The whole thing ended up costing around $1,500 but I paid a little over $400 just for the receiver, an Onkyo TX-DS595 which is suppose to be pretty nice, although I've seen other receivers for $2,000. The cable I bought just to hook my DVD player up to the receiver cost me $45, but it was an optical, and Monster brand at that, which is pretty much top of the line.  I didn't order any Monster speaker wire though, because I heard that Home Depot has a really good price on some quality 12 guage wire, so I'm just going to go that route. Everything else should be arriving this week, so I'll let you know how it sounds when I get it all hooked up.

This will be the last one, I promise! This poem is kind of the beginning point for all of the others I did when I was in high school, so although it's just as crappy as the rest, I guess it deserves and honorable mention for being the first.
Lord, could you send someone my way who understands my heart I've tried and failed with broken dreams I don't know where to start. One who understands the pain inside will take the hurt away My deepest thoughts I can confide Will turn the dark to day. There's a love deep down inside of me A dying, unheard song. Waiting for this one to come Alone, the journey has been so long. Send her please, and let her know my love will be her guide to find me here with open arms forever by my side. She doesn't have to be a beauty queen that's not the meaning of love but what's within, the joy you share is a gift sent from above. When I find that special one my heart will always be true finally knowing what it's like to have someone love me too. -- jeremy bone, 1991
What i wouldn't give to go back to a time when love was less languid and life was worth living.

OK, I'm kind of ticked off. After claiming for the longest time that the Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory: 30th Anniversay Edition DVD would be released in its OAR with an anamorphic transfer, Warner Bros announced that it is now going to be released Pan & Scam only. What a bunch of complete idiots. I did have it preordered, but cancelled it right away when I found this out. It seems that online e-tailers like Amazon are kind of upset about it too. Please take the time and click on the picture below which leads to an online petition you can sign to state your disgust with this poor decision. It already has over 3,500 signatures, so maybe if it gets enough it might actually sway that bloated corporate conglomerate that is AOL-Time Warner to release it in the proper format. Fat chance. "Oompa loompa doom-pa-dee-do, Warner Brothers is in deep poo."

it looks like the majority is in favor of the home theater system, which is cool because that's kind of what I was planning on getting anyway. Thanks to everyone who voted! Now if I can just get to suggest a good system. Preferably below $1,000 with a receiver that has a digital decoder and supports DTS. In other news, I just learned the title of Star Wars Episode II. Attack of the Clones?? What the heck is up with that, it reminds me of Mars Attacks! or something. An exclamation mark would make it better, actually. But then again, I guess Lucas didn't lose too much sleep thinking up such brilliant titles as Return of the Jedi and The Empire Strikes Back either. How about just The Clone Wars? I guess that would be too easy. Ah well, it's content that counts anyway. My only wish for Ep2 is that mass genocide occurs amongst the Gungans. Pleesa God, Nosa moora Jar Jar Binks!

Now that I've got a little cash in the bank, I've been kind of itching to buy something cool for myself.  So I came up with a list of things that I'd like to buy me.  I could get the home theater system or ps2 now, but if I decide on the HDTV, keyboard or computer, I'll need to keep saving for a few more months.  These are all things that I will eventually buy sooner or later, but which do you think I should buy sooner?

<lj-poll-2881>

I went to the Praise in the Rockies concert in Estes Park last night. All of the performers were really good, the more popular ones probably being Jaci Velasquez, Bryan Duncan, and Salvador. I had never heard of Salvador before, but apparently they are kind of popular in some circles. They had a nice Latin beat. It was pretty hilarious watching some of the spectators trying to salsa. Another singer, Lincoln Brewster who I had also not heard of, was pretty interesting. Kind of reminded me of a Christian version of Green Day. My favorite though was yet another guy I hadn't heard of, named Scott Krippayne. He played the keyboard and sang, and did a couple of really great songs. One he wrote for his wife, called (I think) "Seven Years, and Seventy To Go" he had never sang before, and she was in the audience since it was their anniversary. Another one he wrote for his little daughter, May I Have This Dance was really pretty... I think I had something in my eye during that song ;-). I had a great time, although it would have been better without the guy sitting on my left who thought he had a really great singing voice and wanted everyone to know it, and the girl getting freaky with herself right in front of me.

I just figured out that you can also send e-mail to my pager (interesting how they don't tell you these things) by mailing 1149375@archwireless.net. I also went ahead and got a paid livejournal account since I'm rich and all now (sheeah right) so you can also page me from my profile page, . My manager is considering switching out our pagers for mobile phones which I hope, but this is kinda nifty too :-) Also, if you have an alphanumeric pager or mobile phone I came across a cool site called UPOC that offers different free services, such as channels you can join that will send info to your device such as news, concert times, jokes, fortune cookies and lots of other nifty stuff!

Hola! Work is starting to get better now that I've actually been given some responsibilities and have something to occupy my time. A lot of accounts that I'm in charge of are starting to migrate from AIX to linux which is really cool. My project manager knows that I'm pretty knowledgeable with linux and told me he wants me to be in charge of linux development. I just got a pager with text capability, so if any of you get the hankerin' to page me, I set up a webpage where you can send me a text message! Oh yeah, and if you do, don't forget to type in your name too because my psychic abilities are growing weak as of late ;) Changing the subject, I do believe I'm becoming addicted to DVDs. My current collection continues to grow, and I just ordered 3 more today, not to mention about 10 preorders. Stop the insanity!! :)

can i face another day of hurting heart and empty soul without some love along the way i can never be completely whole this world is a deceptive place my happiness is only show love must be a type of grace i'll never be allowed to know it is a burden i must bear one who truly knows how to care and love, but i can't seem to find like my friends this peace of mind of artifice, it's just a game expecting me to do the same trick one into loving me when i really don't, you see this is how my heart did break but i won't again, i swear give my heart up to a fake since shattered dreams i must now bear no never will i give my heart or rather give what's left i guess until i find the missing part each night praying God do bless this one last hope i'm clinging to a love that i have yet to see out there with a heart that's true in time, will share her love with me and make my dream, reality. jeremy bone - 1994

If only
1994 Jeremy Bone

In the day i found you
though i didn't realize
the truth of the love you had
hidden in your eyes.

Afraid to love again
give away another part of me
the world began to darken
and i couldn't see.

If only i could know
you would always be here
if only i could know
that your heart is sincere
if the words you say
i could only believe were true
then loving you wouldn't be
so hard a thing to do.

in the night you reached for me
to help me understand
what true love could be if 
I just held out my hand

but in the dark i was unsure
"just wait for the day"
then somehow i lost your touch
and you slipped away.

If only I could know
how to find a way
if only i could go
back to yesterday
if only i could say
a word and make things new
if only i had only
loved you.

Hoooeeeeeeee! It's a happy day in DVDland. First off, my favorite childhood flick, The Neverending Story, has finally been announced for release later this year! Another Lucas favorite, Willow, has also been announced, as well as Spielberg's Goonies! Other greats that will be released this year: Star Wars Episode I (Sadly no date on the originals yet), Forrest Gump, Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory 30th Anniversary Edition, and Citizen Kane. Oh yeah, I almost forgot Killer Klowns from Outer Space! Happy happy, joy joy!

I apologize for posting all this old stuff I've done, but I find it kind of therapeutic for some reason. I guess it reminds me of a time when I was a little less cynical, albeit a little more naive. Here are parts of a few songs for a musical that I tried to write, but got frustrated early on and never completed it. The plot for the musical could be said to be a cross between Pinnocchio and the musical, Godspell. I actually hadn't heard of Godspell at the time so I didn't realize how closely this resembled it until later. It's about a doll (symbol of innocence and purity) who comes to life but can only be seen by children and adults who believe that he is really alive. To others he appears just as a normal doll. It starts out at a carnival where the dollmaker has a shop set up, and this rich aristocrat comes in and purchases this particular doll for his daughter's birthday. The daughter however is a spoiled brat, and although the doll grows to love her, she throws him out on the street. The dollmaker finds the doll here, but realizes that he is a special doll, and will have a great influence on people. So he leaves him, where he is eventually discovered by a poor peasant girl, who thinks he's the greatest thing in the world. They grow to love each other, and the girl soon realizes that the doll has the power to heal others. But here is where the details are kind of sketchy, because I never worked it out in great length. There is another guy however, who firsts appears to be their friend, but eventually betrays the doll to the evil king. Close to the end he heals the king's sickly son, but dies in order to do it. (To be totally honest, the majority of these songs, like "Why Can't She Love Me" and "Here" I wrote out of personal experiences before I came up with the idea for a musical, and then modified a little to fit). When the first bratty girl throws him out, this is (part of) the song he sings (please remember these are just bits and pieces of songs I jotted down at different times, so some of them might not be that coherent.) I do however have most of the music written out for all of these (which I'm much better at than writing lyrics).
Why Can't She Love Me? I know that I'm different, To be normal, how I've tried. People say I don't have a heart, Then what's this I feel inside? Why can't she love me? I gave her my heart. Does it really matter? To me, it's everything. I'll never forget her. And now I must part, A wiser man, but sadder, As this last song I sing. Why can't she love me? It's such an easy thing to do. I just can't understand it, When I love her so. Why can't she love me? When her love is all I need. But I can't demand it, I must let her go. Did I find a heart Just to give it away? Did I think that she would care? I can only hope I find A place in her heart, somewhere.
This is the song the dollmaker sings when he discoveres the doll laying in the ditch.
My boy! My boy! I'm overcome with joy! I knew that I would find you once again! Come back with me, Together we will be, Away from this awful world of sin! My son, My son, But still it must be done, You still have an important role to play. Now I must part, But knowing in my heart, We'll be together for eternity some day.
"Here" is the song the doll sings when he discoveres he has been betrayed.
Here Do I belong here? From all I've seen it seems there's something wrong here. Love tends to die before it has begun here. There is no sun here The sky is gray. I must stay strong here I must keep my faith and hope will bring a song here. For I know deep in my heart I don't belong here And yet I pray: "Will i find a life here? A purpose to exist in all the strife here? Is there someone who can find love in my heart here? A new start here? A reason to stay?" I will wait here. Though I know that there is so much hate here. Love always seems to come a little late here. But in time I know there will be something great here. And I will wait here, Until I find a way. Until I find love, Someday.
This is the song the girl sings after he dies.
Had I Only Known Had I only known, There would be this much sorrow. I'd open my eyes, And you'd be gone tomorrow. I wouldn't be ashamed To return the love you've shown. I would never, never let you go. Had I only known. You were so innocent Giving unselfishly Never asking in return The love you gave to me. Had I only known The way that we would part. Holding you in my arms, Now I can only hold you in my heart. Had I just one wish, One dream to call my own I would give you all my heart, my love Had I only known.
Here are other bits and pieces of songs that never really got too far.
The mind is not where love lies, Please do realize. True love is found within the heart, For there, it never dies. Let love live, for it can make me stronger Let love last In my heart a little longer I can feel it begin to fade away let love stay if only, for one more day. I am getting older Time goes by so fast But until the day I hold her Let love last. When love was new The only thing in my life was you The only thing in my heart was you The lonely days were few When love was young The happiness in our hearts took wing Our happiness could overcome anything Our song was yet sung When love was true. A heart is broken A dream, awoken. A bitter ending to this fairy-tale A vivid image, which has grown pale. Reality can be quite sad, When a dream is all you had.

Wow. I just finished watching Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon for the first time, and that's the first thing that comes to mind. I had been anticipating it ever since I saw its trailer on the internet last year, but for various reasons never saw it in the theater. So earlier today I bought the DVD at Wal-Mart. I usually never do that, buy a DVD I've never seen before, but this time I made an exception because I had a feeling I would like it. Liking it is too mild a term however. Easily the best film out this year, and the best I've seen in a long time. Great cinematography, great fight sequences, great musical score. Everything was so fluid and graceful, it's like a dance. It's not even in english, but it's hardly noticeable. Now I only regret passing it up for Hannibal when I had the chance to see it at the theater.

There Was a Time by Jeremy Bone 1993 There was a time I was alone No one to hold me To call my own My world was dark Blinded by gray Searching hopelessly In yesterday Then came a day You came to me You opened my eyes And taught me to see Sweetly you sang A song so dear And I had love then When you were here But time moves on And so have you And love it now seems Has left me too There was a time So long ago I loved her once But never let her know There was a day When I could say Love would always be here In my heart to stay Time it goes by And there is doubt A heart is uncertain And love it goes out Where is always Where is sincere Where is forever I can't find it here.
If you got a kick out of Hyakugojyuuichi, then it's a good bet that you will like Mario Twins! The sound effects are truly amazing! Shiggity Shiggity Shwa!

Hehe, here's something funny I stumbled across amongst some of these old papers. I wrote this poem a looong time ago, I think in elementary school. At the time I had this isty-bitsy toothpick of a girlfriend named Leah. Valentine's day was coming up and I asked my mom if she would buy me something for Leah. But she thought I was too young to have a girlfriend then, so she told me I should just write her a poem. "She'll appreciate you more because that's more special than buying something," she said. So I believed her and wrote the following:
<center>
Money can't buy happiness
Its cliche, but yet its true
Still if I were a richer man,
I would spend it all on you.

Maybe diamonds are a girls best friend
And yet they couldn't start
To compare with the gift I send,
The love that's in my heart.

The light in those gems will die
Wealth will be gone some day
But the love between you and I
Will never fade away.

I wish I could give you more
Than just these words of mine
But if a thousand jewels you wore,
No brighter would you shine.

Still I searched the world around,
The most precious gift to find.
Then realized I had already found her,
Leah, my Valentine.
</center>
Then I made a card out of construction paper and put the poem in it. I think she broke up with me the next day.

OK since you all were harrassing me so much, I went ahead and took some pics of my new apartment. Now you can rest easier at night. I'm really getting restless around this place waiting to start work. I talked to my manager on the phone and she said that a few people I would be working with are around my age, so hopefully they will be cool. Well, since I have nothing better to do, here's a little more Pulitzer prize worthy prose of mine from the Mrs. Jones file. I actually only got a 90 on this one because I guess somehow she was able to tell I hadn't actually read the poem "Sentiment" that we were suppose to be critiquing. I was able to tell that because at the top of the paper she wrote "It might help if you read it next time." Pfft, I never read anything in highschool.
My Sentiments on "Sentiment" It is talking about how short life is but how important everything is to an individual if not to anyone else. It explains how eventually everything will come to an end and how many things go unnoticed to many people except the ones involved. I feel that for some reason the man who wrote this poem was thinking about committing suicide because he feels guilty that it was his fault that his friend was in an accident on the way to his son's soccer game, but he wasn't hurt and so he took his friend to the hospital which made him late for the game, and then when he got home he found that a tree had fallen on his house so he had to move to Alaska with his great uncle, and then his great grandnephew fell off a mountain snowskiing, and he blamed it all on himself and he wanted to blow up the world because he was a devil worshipper, but he didn't know how, so he decided to jump in a river instead, but the one he jumped in dried up before he drowned and Lassie found him and took him back to his house, so he decided to raise animals and teach them how to speak instead of sacrifice them to satan but it didn't work and he went crazy because he couldn't die so he wrote this poem.

Mr Midget Man Words and music (c) 1999 Jeremy Bone I met a midget one night I threw him around like everyone else and I laughed like everyone else but he didn't mind because he was drunk and made good money besides. He smiled as he flew through the air happy it seemed as he downed another we handed a big wad to his brother and he disappeared to who knows where. Hey, Mister Midget Man, what's your story, do you have a plan? Would you pay any cost to be in my shoes not to know you had lost before you had a chance to lose? We ran into him at a bar We stood him up and parked the car I dusted him off and apologized he looked me in the eyes and said I'm used to being knocked down but it's not that far to the ground and laughed but behind the smile I could see a frown, as he sang... Yeah I run As fast as I can And I fly So high like Superman but in this big human race it's hard for these legs to keep the pace So we go underground and we feel safe and sound from this big world, and its big people and their big heads. Hey, Mister Midget Man, come on out from under ground we don't care that you're half as tall we stare because we hardly see you at all sure we look down at you but we're not looking down on you. Hey, Mister Midget Man, come on out from under ground and if you fall, just remember this, your view's not that much different after all.

Whew, I'm finally moved in to my new place in Longmont, Colorado. The apartment is really nice, but then again it should be for as expensive as it is. My parents bought me a new bed, chest, kitchen table, and coffee table. The mattress is one of those Simmons Beautyrest where you don't feel it if someone else happens to fall into the bed from a couple stories up. Of course the only one jumping into it is me, but it's still fun. IBM pushed my start date back another week for some reason or another, which is kinda both good and bad.. good in that I have a little longer to do nothing before I start working for the rest of my life, bad in that I'm already starting to get bored here by myself, and I'm not the kind to just make friends with everyone I meet on the street. While unpacking I came across some old papers, songs, poems, etc, I wrote at various times in the past. If I get bored I might post some of the more interesting ones. Want to hear some pretty wacky prank phone calls? Check out blackout's box. I recommend the "Quan Chronicles." It's around 30 minutes long just to warn you, but it's worth it. The guy definitely has some talent, and maybe a little too much time on his hands as well. Well, I'm dialing in long distance to my parent's ISP to check my email and type this, so I'd better go for now. I promise to read everyone's journals when I get a permanent connection again.

Hey peeps! Mom, Ashley and myself drove down to Ore City, TX this past wednesday to be with my grandpa during his surgery. It seems to have gone well and the doc said that they thought they were able to cut out all the cancer. I sure hope so. My 14 yr old cousin Jamie was down there too spending the summer with our grandparents. She said she was going to go with us on the trip to Colorado. My uncle Scott brought over my newest cousin, Marissa, who I got to see for the first time. She's a cutey! I took my digital camera along but forgot about it until right before we left on friday so I whipped it out and snapped a few pics. You can check them out... h e r e. Jamie's brother, Josh, who's gonna be a senior in HS next year, IM'd me a few hours ago and said he's also gonna go with us to CO, so it looks like we're gonna have a nice caravan heading out west. People just can't let me go! :) Definite sign of me getting older/going senile: my parents said that I could either get a new computer or a bed and furniture for my new apartment as a graduation gift... I chose the latter. Slap, slap. But it is justifiable since my futon was about to fall apart and my other furniture was either a) extracted from dumpsters, b) bought for 50 cents at a yard sale, or c) bought for not much more at wal-mart fall-a-part. My poor computer has a serious need for an upgrade too, but I'm crossing my fingers that my new employer might give me one or at least give me a discount on one. Strange occurrence:if you look back not too far in my journal you'll see a random thought I wrote about time, that has "tic, tic, tic" in it. I was watching the boob-tube just the other day and a commercial came on with a man saying "tic, tic, tic" and some line about the importance of time in applications, "tic, tic, tic" blah, blah, really similar to what I wrote. The kicker? The commercial was for none other than guess who... IBM! Needless to say I was freaked out for a little while! Actually, I still am. Hmmm, I wonder...

It's been fun being absolutely worthless the last couple of weeks. My days generally consist of a rotation of the following: computer, piano, tv, book, eat, nap, swim, exercise. I actually did help dad build a flower bed for mom which I'm proud of. Dad put up a small electric fence thingy around another flower bed because the outside dogs were digging in it and it's been fun seeing how long I can hold on to it without passing out. After that wore out I tried to trick some of the dogs into touching it but mom caught me so that was the end of that. As you can tell I've been pretty bored. I've started reading these Left Behind books about the end times predicted in the Bible and so far they are really good. I've always been fascinated by the book of Revelation and end times research so these are right up my alley. I would have started them a lot earlier but I've been reading the Wheel of Time series by Robert Jordan which are HUGE books and between work and class have taken me a couple years to wade through. That's fine though since now I don't have to wait around for the release of another book because a lot of them are out already. I got tired of scanning pictures after a while because it takes forever to scan one not to mention upload them all on this measley analog modem connection. However, the graduation pics from my mom's camera came in and I've scanned some of those... :: graduation :: Nothing special, just a bunch of shots of me sweating like a 10 year old Malaysian kid in a Nike factory wearing the obligatory stupid black hat and robe in 100 degree heat. My grandfather (who appears in some of those graduation pictures) is going into the hospital this week for more skin cancer treatment. They determined that it is malignant. I could tell at graduation that he had gotten a lot weaker than since the last time I saw him. He's the hardest working man I've ever known, and it's hard to accept that he might not be here much longer. He and Mimi are coming with me along with mom on my trip to Colorado which I'm really thankful for because it will give me a chance to spend some quality time with him one more time. Also my sister Ashley is going in for more surgery for her endometriosis in a few more weeks. I really feel for her because I know that must be difficult to deal with. I'm sure they would both appreciate your prayers. Well I'm off to Sleepyland. I'm trying to get in the habit of getting in bed by midnight because I know I'll have to start getting up early to go to work every day when it starts. So far I haven't been that successful.
